title.value: Влияние твердых и жидких органических удобрений на продуктивность культур звена севооборота на дерново-подзолистой супесчаной почве
Crop rotation link productivity under the influence of solid and liquid organic fertilizers on sod-podzolic sandy loam soil

journal.title: Soil Science and Agrochemistry : scientific journal

person.name: Mezentseva, E.G., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute for Soil Science and Agrochemistry

abstract.value: In course of the research there was studied the influence of different types and doses of organic fertilizers on crop rotation link productivity on sod-podzolic sandy loam soil. The research was realized in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus in 2010-2012 in a stationary field experiment in state enterprise 'Suvorov Experimental Base' (Uzda, Minsk region (Belarus)). As a result of realized research it was revealed that the best productivity obtained in variants with organic-mineral fertilizer system - 308.2-316,3 c/ha, at the maximum nutrients removal: nitrogen - 473-501 kg/ha, phosphorus - 215-231 kg/ha, potassium - 539-583 kg/ha. Litter chicken manure (15 t/ha) was characterized by the greatest payback – 424.2 f.u./t. The lowest payback was at cattle liquid manure application (73.8-61.1 f.u./t). The influence of fertilizers on productivity of crop rotation link on sod-podzolic sandy soils, correlation of yield gain from direct influence and after-effect of organic fertilizers, yield of nutrients by crop of crop rotation link in dependence on fertilizer application, balance of nutrients in sod-podzolic sandy soils for the crop rotation link were presented.
